This is SHAME. I'm a soldier from Sri Lanka Army, which I respect till my death. My country is first and the Army is second in my life. What ever said and done by this retired Major General, at the time when General Fonseka was commanding the Army, there was no one to say "NO" to him. Unfortunately, when General Fonseka entered the "clan of Shames and Idiotic politics" only that these people started to talk against him. It is also shame to see that these people are trying to take credit for "Killing a man". 27 years of war was ended by our entire country. Every individual Sri Lankan is part of this victory. There is no "I' in this, it should be "ONLY WE".

Meka ithin pahadhili irisiyawai,kuhakakamai ne me. 2009 balla maruwain passe general kamal ihe kes gan/ ata hema /media ekakatama hema ranawiru dinetama,nidhahas dinetama oka kee parak kiyala thiyenawadha? eya weradhi deyak kiyuwa nam oka niwaradhi karanna awurudhu 7k yanakam me potha eliyata danakam hitiye ei,eyage potha 2017 danna issella general kamal oka eliyata dapu nisa tharahata nedha kiyala apitanam hithenawa. Dan colonel Ravirpiya kiyala dala thiyena foto eke inne General Jagath Dias. Ethanama weradhiyi ne. Mama pora nyaya thamai edha indhalama thibune, war eka, udha jayagrahanaya kiyanne samuhika wedak,hitapu lokka ona dewal nokadawa supply kala wagema international pressure ekata yata nowee nidhahse war eka iwara karanna ida dunna, USA ari strike ekak gena api ahuweth general kamal ge pothen.

WHAT A SHAME!!!!! The book launch , the articles, and comments regarding this subject has exposed how our country thinks as a united nation. Each time Sri Lanka lost either in war, cricket or in politics is due to total selfishness. We lack working towards a common goal together......Our guys will bring in Race, Religion cast creed etc in to it and finally smack them with how much money they have. We truly have to salute the tri forces as well as Police and Prison department who has done an enormous service during the 30+ year war. However most of all, its the general public from all the races and religions who suffered most at the end. We were subject to check ups, restrictions and none from the south could visit the north and the east for many years and everyone who cam from north to south was categorized as terrorists. Mothers and fathers lost Children, Children lost parents , wives lost husbands and vis-a-vis. So at the end each and every Sri Lankan have contributed to this success. Its true that the forces fought the war....but others also contributed immensely towards the success of the war. Also we can see how the politicians, some people from the forces and also the defense contractors who benefited from this war financially. When it comes to the Author of this book and the Field Marshal, They should iron out their personal issues and try to act as Offices and gentlemen. I feel personally that Author should have invited the field marshal for the book launch.This is where he played a political game inviting then president and the Defense Secretary only. Over to the general public for any comments +

I think the majority of commentators here are laymen. If you speak to 100 soldiers who fought the war 99% will tell general Fonseka is the brainchild of the war victory. But non of them like him because he is the most ruthless commander they have ever had in Sri Lanka army. In fact, my brother in law, an army officer in Fonseka's regiment(singha) didn't even vote for him in the election but he says his hero is SF.
